text: Wei Chueh (, 1928 â€“ April 8, 2016) was a Chinese bhikkhu (Buddhist monk) in Taiwan. He was the founder of the Chung Tai Shan monastery and Buddhist order. Wei Chueh is often credited for reviving the traditional teachings of Chan Buddhism. Chueh was born in 1928 in Xikang (modern Sichuan). Chueh died at the age of 88 on April 8, 2016. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Taiwanese religious leaders Category:Buddhist clergy
title: Wei Chueh
